title: Getting Started
text: main thesis behind published resource children adverse events drug exposure just disease process also biological processes growth development. National Institute Child Human Development defines 7 stages child development estimate signals: term neonate (0-27 days), infancy (28 days-1 years), toddler (1 year-2 years), early childhood (2-5 years), middle childhood (6-11 years), early adolescence 12-17 years, late adolescence (18-21 years). database contains tables drug safety signals drug, adverse event, biological ontologies facilitate teasing apart influences contributions adverse drug events childhood.

title: Getting Started
text: package helps identifying, retrieving, loading database. Load library: Connect database: something:  labelled numbers number observed drug reports adverse event. red bars intervals estimated signal drug exposure’s effect occurrence adverse event child development stage. context, risk signal estimate synonymous - use risk model generate drug safety signals. Disconnect database: much can done data found database. Stay tuned vignettes!
code:
library(kidsides) download_sqlite_db(force=TRUE) #downloads to cache, if not already there #> kidsides would like to download a 0.9GB 'sqlite' database to your cache. Is that okay? #> The file will be located at at: /home/runner/.cache/R/kidsides #>  (Yes/no/cancel) con <- connect_sqlite_db() library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(tidyr) library(stringr)  drug_ <- "montelukast; oral" event_ <- "Nightmare"  theme_big <-    theme_classic(base_size=16) +    theme(     strip.text = element_text(color="black",face="bold"),     strip.background = element_blank(),     axis.title.x = element_blank(),     axis.line = element_blank(),     axis.ticks = element_blank(),     axis.text.x = element_text(color="black",face="bold",                                angle=45,vjust=1,hjust=1),     axis.text.y = element_blank(),     axis.title.y = element_text(color="black",face="bold"),     legend.position = "top",     legend.text = element_text(color="black",face="bold"),     legend.key.size = unit(0.4,"cm"),     legend.box.margin = margin(-0.4,-0.4,0,-0.4,unit = "cm")   )  stages <-   c("term_neonatal","infancy",     "toddler","early_childhood",     "middle_childhood","early_adolescence",     "late_adolescence") stages_split <- str_replace(stages,"_","
")  plot_ade_risks <- function(x,color="red",theme=theme_big,ts=5){   x$nichd_split <- str_replace(x$nichd,"_","
")   x$NICHD = factor(x$nichd_split,levels=str_replace(stages,"_","
"))   x %>%      ggplot(aes(factor(nichd_split,levels=stages_split),gam_score,group=ade)) +     geom_bar(stat="identity",aes(y=log10(as.numeric(DE)+1)),fill="lightgray",color="black") +     ggrepel::geom_label_repel(       aes(         label=DE,         y=log10(as.numeric(DE)+1)       ),       vjust=1.3,fontface="bold",size=ts) +     geom_point(color=color,size=2) +     geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=gam_score_90mse,ymax=gam_score_90pse),                   width=0.1,color=color,linewidth=1) +     geom_hline(yintercept = 0,color="black",linewidth=0.5) +     facet_wrap(~ade_name,labeller = label_wrap_gen(width = 20)) +     xlab("") +     ylab("Risk of ADE (GAM log odds)") +      theme +     theme(       axis.line = element_line(),       axis.ticks = element_line(),       axis.text.y = element_text(color="black",face="bold",size=12)     )    }  tbl(con,"ade_nichd") %>%      filter(ade_name==paste0(drug_," and ",event_)) %>%      collect() %>%      plot_ade_risks() disconnect_sqlite_db(con)

title: Overview
text: Adverse drug reactions leading cause morbidity mortality costs billions dollars healthcare system. children, increased risk adverse drug reactions potentially lasting adverse effects adulthood. current pediatric drug safety landscape, including clinical trials, limited rarely includes children relies extrapolation adults. Children small adults go evolutionarily conserved physiologically dynamic process growth maturation. hypothesize adverse drug reactions manifest interaction drug exposure dynamic biological processes child growth development. hypothesize developing statistical methodologies prior knowledge dynamic, shared information development, can improve detection adverse drug events children. data package downloads SQLite database created applying covariate-adjusted disproportionality generalized additive models (dGAMs) systematic way develop resource nearly half million adverse drug event (ADE) risk estimates across child development stages.

title: Overview
text: observation-level data, case reports drug(s) potentially linked adverse event(s), collected Food Drug Administration Adverse Event System (FAERS) US. data publicly available openFDA platform downloadable json files. However, utilizing data -non-trivial, drug event report data published chunks nested json structure quarter per year since 1990s. API key extended permissions, developed custom python notebooks scripts available ‘openFDA_drug_event-parsing’ github repository (DOI: https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4464544) extract format drug event reports prior third quarter 2019. observation-level data used, called Pediatric FAERS, downstream analyses stored table ade_raw.

title: Overview
text: drugs adverse events reported coded standard, hierarchical vocabularies. Adverse events standardized Medical Dictionary Regulatory Activities (MedDRA) vocabulary (details hierarchy founds ). Drugs standardized Anatomical Therapeutic Class (ATC) vocabulary (details found ). reporting adverse events drugs can dependent disease context report’s subject. represented summarizing number drugs therapeutic class report.

title: Overview
text: invented disproportionality generalized additive model (dGAM) method detecting adverse drug events spontaneous reports. applied logistic generalized additive model unique drug-event pairs Pediatric FAERS. drug-event GAM used quantify adverse event risk due drug exposure versus exposure across child development stages. Please see references full specification details GAM.

title: Overview
text: provide PDSportal accessible web application well plaatform download database community explore identifying safety endpoints clinical trials evaluating known novel developmental pharmacology.

title: Overview
text: kidsides R package downloads sqlite database local machine connects database using DBI R package. novel data resource half million pediatric drug safety signals across growth development stages. Please see references details data fields code repository paper.

title: Overview
text: Giangreco, Nicholas. Mind developmental gap: Identifying adverse drug effects across childhood evaluate biological mechanisms growth development. 2022. Columbia University, PhD dissertation. Giangreco NP, Tatonetti NP. database pediatric drug effects evaluate ontogenic mechanisms child growth development. Med (N Y). 2022 Aug 12;3(8):579-595.e7. doi: 10.1016/j.medj.2022.06.001. Epub 2022 Jun 24. PMID: 35752163; PMCID: PMC9378670.

title: Extracting datasets from KidSIDES
text: users, bit unwieldy using ~900 MB database. Even 17 tables database pretty large! subset data (10MB) manageable work . vignette gives non-exhaustive list manageable datasets KidSIDES database.

what: Extract smaller datasets by drugs and events
title: Extracting datasets from KidSIDES
text: Extracting datasets KidSIDES requires interacting standard vocabularies drugs events. Drugs represented Anatomical Therapeutic Class vocabulary (Reference ). Events encoded Medical Dictionary Regulatory Activities vocabulary (Reference MedDRA). can interact vocabularies identifying drugs events using PDSportal. shiny application first identifying drugs events interest viewing drug safety signals across childhood. document, example datasets extracted using specific drug event:
code: drug_ <-      tbl(con,"drug") %>%      filter(atc_concept_name=="montelukast; oral") %>%       collect() %>%      pull(atc_concept_name) drug_id_ <-      tbl(con,"drug") %>%      filter(atc_concept_name==drug_) %>%      collect() %>%      pull(atc_concept_id) event_ <-      tbl(con,"event") %>%      filter(meddra_concept_name_1=="Suicidal ideation") %>%       collect() %>%      pull(meddra_concept_name_1) event_id_ <-      tbl(con,"event") %>%      filter(meddra_concept_name_1==event_) %>%       collect() %>%      pull(meddra_concept_id)  drug_ #> [1] "montelukast; oral" drug_id_ #> [1] 21603356 event_ #> [1] "Suicidal ideation" event_id_ #> [1] 36919235

previous_headings: Extract smaller datasets by drugs and events
title: Extracting datasets from KidSIDES
text: Table reported drugs ATC vocabulary KidSIDES.
code: table_ <- "drug"  df <-      dplyr::tbl(con,table_) %>%      dplyr::collect()  df %>% dim() #> [1] 1088   12 df %>% lobstr::obj_size() #> 336.13 kB df %>% head(1000) %>% DT::datatable(options = list(pageLengt=5,scrollX = TRUE)) gt <-      dplyr::tbl(con,"dictionary") %>%      dplyr::filter(table==table_) %>%      gt()  gt

previous_headings: Extract smaller datasets by drugs and events
title: Extracting datasets from KidSIDES
text: Table co-reported events MedDRA vocabulary KidSIDES.
code: table_ <- "event"  df <-      dplyr::tbl(con,table_) %>%      dplyr::collect()  df %>% dim() #> [1] 16941    22 df %>% lobstr::obj_size() #> 4.41 MB df %>% head(1000) %>% DT::datatable(options = list(pageLengt=5,scrollX = TRUE)) gt <-      dplyr::tbl(con,"dictionary") %>%      dplyr::filter(table==table_) %>%      gt()  gt

previous_headings: Extract smaller datasets by drugs and events
title: Extracting datasets from KidSIDES
text: Table report characteristics drugs reports events KidSIDES.
code: table_ <- "ade_raw"  #dataset size for most frequent drug dplyr::tbl(con,table_) %>%      dplyr::filter(atc_concept_id=="21603929") %>%      dplyr::collect() %>%      lobstr::obj_size() #> 9.97 MB  #dataset size for least frequent drug dplyr::tbl(con,table_) %>%      dplyr::filter(atc_concept_id=="21600407") %>%      dplyr::collect() %>%      lobstr::obj_size() #> 4.21 kB  #datasets using pre-selected drugs and events df <-      dplyr::tbl(con,table_) %>%      dplyr::filter(         atc_concept_id==drug_id_     ) %>%      dplyr::collect()  df %>% dim() #> [1] 28300    23 df %>% lobstr::obj_size() #> 5.69 MB df %>% head(1000) %>% DT::datatable(options = list(pageLengt=5,scrollX = TRUE)) df <-      dplyr::tbl(con,table_) %>%      dplyr::filter(         atc_concept_id==drug_id_ &             meddra_concept_id==event_id_     ) %>%      dplyr::collect()  df %>% dim() #> [1] 505  23 df %>% lobstr::obj_size() #> 147.40 kB df %>% head(1000) %>% DT::datatable(options = list(pageLengt=5,scrollX = TRUE)) gt <-      dplyr::tbl(con,"dictionary") %>%      dplyr::filter(table==table_) %>%      gt()  gt

what: Example 4: Pediatric drug safety signal dataset
title: Extracting datasets from KidSIDES
text: Table drug-event observations including signal chharacteristics KidSIDES.
code: table_ <- "ade"  #Significant signals df <-      dplyr::tbl(con,table_) %>%      dplyr::filter(gt_null_99==1) %>%      dplyr::collect()  df %>% dim() #> [1] 19438     9 df %>% lobstr::obj_size() #> 2.81 MB df %>% head(1000) %>% DT::datatable(options = list(pageLengt=5,scrollX = TRUE)) gt <-      dplyr::tbl(con,"dictionary") %>%      dplyr::filter(table==table_) %>%      gt()  gt

previous_headings: Extract smaller datasets by drugs and events
what: Example 5: Pediatric drug safety signal time series dataset
title: Extracting datasets from KidSIDES
text: Table drug safety signals across childhood KidSIDES.
code: table_ <- "ade_nichd"  df <-      dplyr::tbl(con,table_) %>%      dplyr::filter(ade_name==paste0(drug_," and ",event_)) %>%      dplyr::collect()  df %>% dim() #> [1]  7 13 df %>% lobstr::obj_size() #> 3.75 kB df %>% head(1000) %>% DT::datatable(options = list(pageLengt=5,scrollX = TRUE)) df <-      dplyr::tbl(con,table_) %>%      dplyr::filter(atc_concept_id==drug_id_) %>%      dplyr::collect()  df %>% dim() #> [1] 17360    13 df %>% lobstr::obj_size() #> 1.90 MB df %>% head(1000) %>% DT::datatable(options = list(pageLengt=5,scrollX = TRUE)) gt <-      dplyr::tbl(con,"dictionary") %>%      dplyr::filter(table==table_) %>%      gt()  gt

previous_headings: Extract smaller datasets by drugs and events
what: Example 6: Significant drug safety signal class enrichments
title: Extracting datasets from KidSIDES
text: Table drug event classes significant drug safety signal enrichment KidSIDES.
code: table_ <- "ade_nichd_enrichment"  df <-      tbl(con,table_) %>%      dplyr::filter(         is.na(atc_concept_class_id) &         meddra_concept_class_id=="SOC"     ) %>%      dplyr::collect()  df %>% dim() #> [1] 189  15 df %>% lobstr::obj_size() #> 25.38 kB df %>% head(1000) %>% DT::datatable(options = list(pageLengt=5,scrollX = TRUE)) iter <-      dplyr::tbl(con,table_) %>%      select(atc_concept_class_id,meddra_concept_class_id) %>%      distinct() %>%      collect() %>%      drop_na()  gt <- purrr::map(1:nrow(iter),~{     df <-          tbl(con,table_) %>%          dplyr::filter(         atc_concept_class_id==!!iter[.x,                                    "atc_concept_class_id",                                    drop=T] &         meddra_concept_class_id==!!iter[.x,                                       "meddra_concept_class_id",                                       drop=T]       ) %>%        dplyr::collect()          size <- df %>%          lobstr::obj_size() %>%          as.numeric()          dplyr::tibble(         "atc_concept_class_id" = iter[.x,                                    "atc_concept_class_id",                                    drop=T],         "meddra_concept_class_id" = iter[.x,                                       "meddra_concept_class_id",                                       drop=T],          "Object size" = size %>% prettyunits::pretty_bytes()        )  }) %>%      bind_rows() %>%      gt()  gt gt <-      dplyr::tbl(con,"dictionary") %>%      dplyr::filter(table==table_) %>%      gt()  gt

previous_headings: Extract smaller datasets by drugs and events
title: Extracting datasets from KidSIDES
text: Table gene expression across childhood KidSIDES.
code: table_ <- "gene_expression"  df <-      dplyr::tbl(con,table_) %>%      dplyr::collect() %>%      dplyr::select(sample,nichd,probe,gene_symbol,prediction) %>%      dplyr::collect()  df %>% dim() #> [1] 194054      5 df %>% lobstr::obj_size() #> 7.87 MB df %>% head(1000) %>% DT::datatable(options = list(pageLengt=5,scrollX = TRUE)) gt <-      dplyr::tbl(con,"dictionary") %>%      dplyr::filter(table==table_) %>%      gt()  gt

what: Download, Cache, and Connect to KidSIDES
title: Download, Cache, and Connect to KidSIDES
text: R data package contains observation, summary, model-level data pediatric drug safety research developed Nicholas Giangreco PhD dissertation Tatonetti lab Columbia University.

title: Download, Cache, and Connect to KidSIDES
text: database downloaded consent given using package. Installing package download database, make easier download connect database R session.
code: install.packages('kidsides') remotes::install_github("ngiangre/kidsides")

title: Download, Cache, and Connect to KidSIDES
text: database comprised 17 tables including table descriptions fields table. main table, ade_nichd, contains quantitative data nearly 500,000 pediatric drug safety signals across 7 child development stages spanning birth late adolescence (21 years age). database created using methods analyses references. data resource can used CC 4.0 license agreement. See Overview vignette details data online portal

title: Download, Cache, and Connect to KidSIDES
code: library(kidsides) kidsides::download_sqlite_db(force=TRUE) ## kidsides would like to download a 0.9GB 'sqlite' database to your cache. Is that okay? ## The file will be located at at: /Users/nickgiangreco/Library/Caches/org.R-project.R/R/kidsides ##  (Yes/no/cancel) con <- kidsides::connect_sqlite_db()  DBI::dbListTables(con) ##  [1] "ade"                                            ##  [2] "ade_nichd"                                      ##  [3] "ade_nichd_enrichment"                           ##  [4] "ade_null"                                       ##  [5] "ade_null_distribution"                          ##  [6] "ade_raw"                                        ##  [7] "atc_raw_map"                                    ##  [8] "cyp_gene_expression_substrate_risk_information" ##  [9] "dictionary"                                     ## [10] "drug"                                           ## [11] "drug_gene"                                      ## [12] "event"                                          ## [13] "gene"                                           ## [14] "gene_expression"                                ## [15] "grip"                                           ## [16] "ryan"                                           ## [17] "sider" library(dplyr) ##  ## Attaching package: 'dplyr'  ## The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': ##  ##     filter, lag  ## The following objects are masked from 'package:base': ##  ##     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union dplyr::tbl(con,"dictionary") %>%      dplyr::collect() ## # A tibble: 152 × 4 ##    table field             description                                     type  ##    <chr> <chr>             <chr>                                           <chr> ##  1 drug  atc_concept_id    The ATC 5th level OMOP concept identifier.      int   ##  2 drug  atc_concept_name  The ATC 5th level OMOP concept name. In the ad… char… ##  3 drug  atc_concept_code  The ATC 5th level OMOP concept code.            char… ##  4 drug  ndrugreports      The number of reports of the drug in Pediatric… int   ##  5 drug  atc4_concept_name The ATC 4th level OMOP concept name.            char… ##  6 drug  atc4_concept_code The ATC 4th level OMOP concept code.            char… ##  7 drug  atc3_concept_name The ATC 3rd level OMOP concept name.            char… ##  8 drug  atc3_concept_code The ATC 3rd level OMOP concept code.            char… ##  9 drug  atc2_concept_name The ATC 2nd level OMOP concept name.            char… ## 10 drug  atc2_concept_code The ATC 2nd level OMOP concept code.            char… ## # … with 142 more rows dplyr::tbl(con,"ade_nichd") %>%      dplyr::collect() ## # A tibble: 3,225,859 × 13 ##    atc_c…¹ meddr…² ade   nichd gam_s…³  norm gam_s…⁴ gam_s…⁵ gam_s…⁶     D     E ##      <int>   <int> <chr> <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> <int> <int> ##  1 1588648  3.58e7 1588… term…  -0.131 0        2.48 -4.21      3.95     0    20 ##  2 1588648  3.58e7 1588… infa…   0.947 0.166    1.98 -2.31      4.21     0    80 ##  3 1588648  3.58e7 1588… todd…   2.03  0.332    1.79 -0.923     4.98     0   107 ##  4 1588648  3.58e7 1588… earl…   3.11  0.499    1.86  0.0553    6.17     0   294 ##  5 1588648  3.58e7 1588… midd…   4.21  0.667    2.10  0.745     7.67     0  1046 ##  6 1588648  3.58e7 1588… earl…   5.30  0.834    2.52  1.15      9.44     1  2697 ##  7 1588648  3.58e7 1588… late…   6.38  1        3.14  1.21     11.5      0  1729 ##  8 1588648  3.63e7 1588… term…  -0.310 0        5.61 -9.53      8.91     0     0 ##  9 1588648  3.63e7 1588… infa…   2.25  0.166    4.43 -5.05      9.54     0     2 ## 10 1588648  3.63e7 1588… todd…   4.81  0.332    3.79 -1.43     11.1      0     6 ## # … with 3,225,849 more rows, 2 more variables: DE <int>, ade_name <chr>, and ## #   abbreviated variable names ¹​atc_concept_id, ²​meddra_concept_id, ³​gam_score, ## #   ⁴​gam_score_se, ⁵​gam_score_90mse, ⁶​gam_score_90pse dplyr::tbl(con,"ade") %>%      dplyr::collect() ## # A tibble: 460,823 × 9 ##    ade           atc_c…¹ meddr…² clust…³ gt_nu…⁴ gt_nu…⁵ max_s…⁶ clust…⁷ ade_n…⁸ ##    <chr>           <int>   <int> <chr>     <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   ##  1 1588648_3580… 1588648  3.58e7 2             1       0 late_a… Increa… 1       ##  8 10003388  2160…  2.16e7  3.52e7 late… Fema… Consum… 2014-0…     0     0     1 ##  9 10003388  2160…  2.16e7  3.58e7 late… Fema… Consum… 2014-0…     0     0     1 ## 10 10003401  2160…  2.16e7  3.61e7 earl… Fema… Consum… 2014-0…     0     0     1 ## what: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
title: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
text: Download database published Giangreco et al. 2022. function prompt download database, cache directory identified database downloaded consent. Warning, size uncompressed 'sqlite' file close 0.9GB 900 MB. Use caution.

title: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
code: download_sqlite_db(   method = "auto",   quiet = FALSE,   timeout = 1000,   force = FALSE )

title: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
text: method method download sqlite database. See download.file quiet Whether download quietly. See download.file timeout Extended download session downloading file. Default 1000 seconds. force Whether force download database. Defaults FALSE. Needs TRUE database download. function prompt confirmation.

title: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
text: TRUE, invisibly

title: Download the Pediatric Drug Safety database — download_sqlite_db
code: if(FALSE){ download_sqlite_db() #set force=TRUE if desired to download 0.9GB file to machine }

title: Return database cache — get_db_path
text: function returns URL, sqlite database file, cache names used downloading database machine.
